intro: Chromochiton affinis, commonly known as the golden star coral, is a species of soft coral found in shallow tropical and subtropical waters. It belongs to the family Alcyoniidae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow coloration and branching structure. The coral has a delicate, flexible skeleton made of calcium carbonate, which provides structural support. Its polyps are typically small and can extend during the day to capture planktonic food. This species plays an important role in reef ecosystems by offering habitat and shelter to various marine organisms.
